title: JSON schema for @sap/cds-lsp user settings
description: This is a JSON schema representation for @sap/cds-lsp user settings

cds.compiler.markMissingI18nDefault.label: Mark Missing I18n Default
cds.compiler.markMissingI18nDefault.description:
Show warning problem markers for unresolved `i18n` references.

**NOTE:** For huge models it may show performance degradations

cds.compiler.showInternalErrors.label: Show Internal Errors
cds.compiler.showInternalErrors.description: Print internal compiler errors to the console

cds.completion.docFiles.label: Documentation Files
cds.completion.docFiles.description: Potential names of files to show as documentation. This is an ordered list. The first filename that exists is used.

cds.completion.formatSnippets.label: Format Snippets
cds.completion.formatSnippets.description: Format snippets after applying in code completion

cds.completion.annotations.omitRedundant.label: Omit Redundant Types in Snippets
cds.completion.annotations.omitRedundant.description: Omit redundant record types in suggested snippets

cds.completion.workspaceSymbols.maxPropo.label: Max Proposals
cds.completion.workspaceSymbols.maxPropo.description: Maximum number of workspace symbols to suggest. Default is `-1` (all)

cds.completion.workspaceSymbols.minPrefi.label: Min Prefix Length
cds.completion.workspaceSymbols.minPrefi.description: Number of characters required to suggest (global) workspace symbols. Default is `-1` (switched off - the feature may delay completion)

cds.completion.workspaceSymbols.useShort.label: Use Short Name
cds.completion.workspaceSymbols.useShort.description: When using workspace symbols proposals, only match the short name (last name segment) instead of the fully qualified name

cds.contributions.registry.label: Registry
cds.contributions.registry.description: NPM registry to be used for installation/update of contributions (e.g. OData annotation support)

cds.contributions.enablement.additionalA.label: Additional Analytical Annotations
cds.contributions.enablement.additionalA.description:
Provide support for additional annotations used CAP Embedded Analytics

See [capire](https://cap.cloud.sap/docs) for details

cds.contributions.features.index.label: Index
cds.contributions.features.index.description: Enable _Goto Definition_ and _Find References_ for annotations

cds.contributions.enablement.odata.label: OData
cds.contributions.enablement.odata.description: Provide extended annotation support for OData

cds.contributions.features.semanticHighl.label: Semantic Highlighting
cds.contributions.features.semanticHighl.description: Enable semantic highlighting for annotations (additionally requires `cds.semanticHighlighting.enabled` to be enabled)

cds.diagnosticsSeverity.label: Severity Level
cds.diagnosticsSeverity.description: Minimum severity of compiler messages to show in _Problems_ view

cds.quickfix.importArtifact.label: Import Artifact
cds.quickfix.importArtifact.description: Provide a _quick fix_ for artifacts not yet imported (default disabled - the feature is CPU intensive)

cds.outline.semantical.label: Semantical
cds.outline.semantical.description: Show a semantical outline structure as opposed to the (default) flat list

cds.outline.elements.associationComposit.label: Show Association/Composition
cds.outline.elements.associationComposit.description: Use specific icons for _Association_ and _Composition_ elements in _Outline_

cds.refactoring.files.delete.enabled.label: Update Usings on Delete
cds.refactoring.files.delete.enabled.description: Adapt `using` statements in other files when deleting CDS files

cds.refactoring.files.rename.enabled.label: Update Usings on Rename
cds.refactoring.files.rename.enabled.description: Adapt `using` statements in other files when renaming CDS files

cds.whereused.showGenericAnnotations.label: Show Generic Annotations
cds.whereused.showGenericAnnotations.description: Find usages of same annotation names via _References_ command and explicit annotation definitions via _Definition_ command

cds.whereused.showStringConstants.label: Show String Literals
cds.whereused.showStringConstants.description: Find same string constants via _References_ command

cds.typeGenerator.enabled.label: Enabled
cds.typeGenerator.enabled.description:
Generate type definitions.
Requires `@cap-js/cds-typer` to be installed

cds.typeGenerator.command.label: Command
cds.typeGenerator.command.description:
The command that is executed when generating model types. You can use the following variables in your command template:

- `${typerBinary}`: the binary
- `${targetFile}`: the file that is being typed
- `${outputDirectory}`: the directory into which the type information is generated

cds.typeGenerator.outputPath.label: Output Path
cds.typeGenerator.outputPath.description: Directory that serves as root for the generated type definitions. Relative to the project's root

cds.workspace.persistency.enabled.label: Persistency Enabled
cds.workspace.persistency.enabled.description: (Experimental) Enable persistency of where-used indexes for faster access of references and workspace symbols

cds.workspace.persistency.restoreAfterSt.label: Restore After Startup
cds.workspace.persistency.restoreAfterSt.description: At startup restore all persisted where-used indexes

cds.workspace.persistency.restoreBeforeC.label: Restore Before Compile
cds.workspace.persistency.restoreBeforeC.description: When compiling a model reuse persisted where-used indexes of dependent models

cds.workspace.persistency.persistAfterCo.label: Persist After Compile
cds.workspace.persistency.persistAfterCo.description: Persist where-used indexes after a compile e.g. when changing a file

cds.workspace.persistency.persistAfterSa.label: Persist After Save
cds.workspace.persistency.persistAfterSa.description: Persist where-used index of a CDS model file after save

cds.workspace.persistency.indexAllAfterS.label: Index All After Startup
cds.workspace.persistency.indexAllAfterS.description: At startup index missing/outdated where-used indexes

cds.workspace.persistency.reindexAfterCo.label: Reindex After Compile If Restored
cds.workspace.persistency.reindexAfterCo.description: Ignore a persisted where-used index and reindex at compile even if the source content has not changed

cds.workspace.persistency.garbageCollect.label: Garbage Collect After Startup
cds.workspace.persistency.garbageCollect.description: At startup remove outdated where-used index files

cds.workspace.persistency.garbageCollect.label: Garbage Collect After N Saves
cds.workspace.persistency.garbageCollect.description: Remove outdated where-used index files when a certain number of saves are done

cds.workspace.scanCsn.label: Scan CSN Files
cds.workspace.scanCsn.description:
How CSN files are detected:
- `ByFileExtension` (default): CSN files (.csn or .csn.json) will be included in validation and workspace symbols
- `InspectJson`: additionally looks into .json files if they are valid CSN. This will take considerably more time at scanning
- `Off`: will not scan for CSN files at all

cds.workspace.scanDependentModules.label: Scan Dependent Modules
cds.workspace.scanDependentModules.description: Scan first level dependencies in node_modules. This may increase start-up time. Enable if you want code completions for global identifiers and import paths, or want to see definitions of dependencies in workspace symbols

cds.workspaceValidationMode.label: Validation Mode
cds.workspaceValidationMode.description:
Specify which CDS files are validated:
- `ActiveEditorOnly` (default): only the active editor is validated
- `OpenEditorsOnly` additionally keeps other open editors' validation up-to-date

cds.workspaceSymbols.caseInsensitive.label: Case-Insensitive Symbols
cds.workspaceSymbols.caseInsensitive.description: _Workspace Symbols_ will show symbols containing the given query, independent of character casings

cds.workspaceSymbols.lazy.label: Lazy Load Symbols
cds.workspaceSymbols.lazy.description: _Workspace Symbols_ will show symbols that have the queried characters in the right order, but not necessarily consecutive

sapbas.telemetryEnabled.label: Enable Telemetry
sapbas.telemetryEnabled.description: Enable collecting usage analytics data. If enabled, non-personally identifiable information is used to help understand the product usage and improve the tool.
